Key Arguments: The legislation would lead to censorship by allowing ACMA or any government body to decide what constitutes misinformation or disinformation.
Such censorship would infringe on free speech rights and individual sovereignty.
The power to determine misinformation could lead to an Orwellian, totalitarian state.
There is a perceived hypocrisy in the government exempting itself from such censorship.
The legislation could lead to a slippery slope where dissenting views are punished, similar to events in Canada with truckers.
Notable Quotes: I reject strongly that ACMA would even consider this censorship, to formulate a bill to present to Parliament disavowing our free speech rights as a human being.
Choosing for me and others what we can hear or say or see on social media is an affront to our sovereignty to choose for myself and be responsible for my choices.
We have the Fox guarding the Hen House. One law for us, another for them.
